title: Real Analysis
prereq: Multivariable Calculus, Differential Equations, Linear Algebra
textbooks: (R) Tao - Volumes on Analysis; (A) Rudin - Principles of Mathematical Analysis
description: Real Analysis is generally the first course one takes in mathematical analysis. It offers a rigorous study of the results of Calculus.
topics: The Real Numbers, Sets, Differentiation, Limits, Continuity, Integration, Metric Spaces, Riemann Integral, Lebesgue Integration Theory, General Topology

title: Introductory Complex Analysis
prereq: Multivariable Calculus, Differential Equations, Linear Algebra, Real Analysis
textbooks: (R) Brown & Churchill - Complex Variables and Applications; (A) Needham - Visual Complex Analysis
description: Complex Analysis is a beautiful subject concerning the study of functions of a complex variable and their applications.
topics: Complex Numbers, Analytic Functions, Complex Integrals & Complex Derivatives, Conformal Mappings

title: Abstract Algebra
prereq: Multivariable Calculus, Differential Equations, Linear Algebra, Real Analysis
textbooks: (R) Artin - Algebra; (A) Dummit & Foote - Abstract Algebra
topics: Matrices, Group Theory, Vector Spaces, Linear Operators, Symmetry, Bilinear Forms, Rings, Fields, Galois Theory
